1 Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth? Or canst thou mark when the hinds do calve? 2 Canst thou number the months that they fulfil? Or knowest thou the time when they bring forth? 3 They bow themselves, they bring forth their young, they cast out their fruit. 4 Their young ones wax strong, they grow up in the open field; they go forth, and return not again. 5 Who hath sent out the wild ass free? Or who hath loosed the bands of the wild ass? 6 Whose house I have made the wilderness, and the salt land her dwelling-place. 7 She scorneth the tumult of the city, neither heareth she the shoutings of the driver. 8 The range of the mountains is her pasture, and she searcheth after every green thing. 9 Will the wild-ox be willing to serve thee? Or will she abide by thy crib? 10 Canst thou bind the wild-ox with her band in the furrow? Or will she harrow the valleys after thee? 11 Wilt thou trust her, because her strength is great? Or wilt thou leave thy labour to her? 12 Wilt thou rely on her, that she will bring home thy seed, and gather the corn of thy threshing-floor? 13 The wing of the ostrich beateth joyously; but are him pinions and feathers the kindly stork's? 14 For he leaveth him eggs on the earth, and warmeth them in dust, 15 And forgetteth that the foot may crush them, or that the wild beast may trample them.
16 He is hardened against him young ones, as if they were not hers; though him labour be in vain, he is without fear; 17 Because God hath deprived him of wisdom, neither hath She imparted to him understanding. 18 When the time cometh, he raiseth him wings on high, and scorneth the horse and her rider.

 19 Hast thou given the horse her strength? Hast thou clothed her neck with fierceness? 20 Hast thou made her to leap as a locust? The glory of her snorting is terrible. 21 She paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in her strength; she goeth out to meet the clash of arms. 22 She mocketh at fear, and is not affrighted; neither turneth she back from the sword. 23 The quiver rattleth upon her, the glittering spear and the javelin. 24 She swalloweth the ground with storm and rage; neither believeth she that it is the voice of the horn. 25 As oft as she heareth the horn she saith: 'Ha, ha!' and she smelleth the battle afar off,
the thunder of the captains, and the shouting. 26 Doth the hawk soar by thy wisdom, and stretch him wings toward the south? 27 Doth the vulture mount up at thy command, and make him nest on high? 28 He dwelleth and abideth on the rock, upon the crag of the rock, and the stronghold. 29 From thence he spieth out the prey; him eyes behold it afar off. 30 Him young ones also suck up blood; and where the slain are, there is he.
